abstract: Robert W Galvin, who transformed Motorola from a moderately successful postwar enterprise into a high-tech international giant, dies at age 89.
snippet: Mr. Galvin turned Motorola from a family business into a global maker of color television sets, cellphones and other ubiquities of the electronic age.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Galvin turned Motorola from a family business into a global maker of color television sets, cellphones and other ubiquities of the electronic age.

headline.main: Robert W. Galvin, Who Ushered Motorola Into the Modern Era, Dies at 89
headline.seo: Robert W. Galvin, Who Led Motorola Into the Modern Age, Dies at 89
